quest.name: Bonds of Adamant(ite)
journal: Kokkol Dankkol is, as usual, worked up over the aetherburner.
objectives: Proceed to the entrance of Thaumazein.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: I did thoroughly brief Kokkol on refined adamantite's history. I only volunteered to go to the reactor because I had finished and there was little else to do.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Hopefully that dispels any misapprehensions that I was kicked out for prattling on...

dialogue.name: KOKKOLDANKKOL
dialogue.text: <sigh> I do trust you to deliver on your promise, I do. Only...

dialogue.name: KOKKOLDANKKOL
dialogue.text: I hate waitin'! I want that adamantite, and I want it now!

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: We...er, share your impatience, I assure you. Is there truly nothing else we can assist with in the meantime?

dialogue.name: KOKKOLDANKKOL
dialogue.text: I wish! This sittin' about's unbearable. Pity the Forum frowns on recreational explosions...

dialogue.name: KOKKOLDANKKOL
dialogue.text: Well, so long as they can't prove it was premeditated. Get you gone─I've mistakes to make!

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: ...In that case, I suppose I should go and return the key to the reactor. I'll have one more look to make sure that nothing has gone wrong. Unintentionally or otherwise.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: I'm certain there are better uses for your time, however. I will join you in Sharlayan Hamlet anon!

dialogue.name: KOKKOLDANKKOL
dialogue.text: Any smoke risin' from the building behind me will be entirely unrelated to what I didn't say, got it?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: If you wait here, your companions are bound to turn up sooner or later...

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Await your companions?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I had no idea how massive a weight it was until he lifted it off my shoulders... But more importantly, his words were an affirmation that the path we walk is the right one.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: A part of me might have been satisfied so long as my family and friends survived the Final Days. But to save this star is what we all want most, and if those same people believe that I can help see it done, who am I to say otherwise?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Come what may, I will fight for this world of ours until the very end.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: If I never see another crate again, it will be too soon.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Unaided, we Scions could never have gathered such a bounty. Refined adamantite, relics sacred and ancient alike...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: I find myself quite overcome.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Lyse sent a letter along with Gridania's contribution. It seems she traveled there to aid in their adamantite recovery.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Evidently, journeying to Gridania was quite the trial. As was getting into the Dalamud shard. As was reaching its depths...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I suspect she will have few kind words to say about the Allagans when next we meet.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: I cannot wait to see what our friends from the Ironworks do with the ship!

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: The time has come to claim our prize. Are you prepared?

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: I apologize for not informing you earlier of Erenville's involvement. He was something of a contingency plan.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Thank goodness we had him and his fellow gleaners to hand, though. It would have been monstrously difficult to locate Cid and transport the Hannish delegation here otherwise...

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: <cough> My throat hurts from directing so many people to Labyrinthos...but that only proves we got our money's worth!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: We've finally managed to clear the harbor, which means the rest is in the engineers' capable hands.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Meanwhile, Father has issued to us an invitation.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: As was agreed, he will reveal the means by which Hydaelyn may be contacted.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: We are to meet him at Aporia when we're ready. Given the vital knowledge She holds, I suggest we leave without delay.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: It transpires, however, that the Forum's method for speaking with Her is not without risks. I am curious to hear what those might entail─but regardless, be warned.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Most of those who arrived with the adamantite have offered to stay and see to any remaining tasks that need doing.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: The Forum has already asked for my assistance in overseeing the process, so you needn't worry about a thing!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Thank you, Tataru. We're off to Aporia, then!

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: I don't want any of you getting hurt─but I do hope you'll wring as much information out of Hydaelyn as you can. For all we know, this is the one and only opportunity we'll get.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: Forename. I have already shown the others inside.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: You will want to speak with Clarilaine. She has the key to the lift, and can send you down after me.

dialogue.name: CLARILAINE
dialogue.text: You're with Master Fourchenault, yes? Just step inside the lift here.

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: Descend to the lower levels?

dialogue.name: CLARILAINE
dialogue.text: You are welcome to use the lift whenever you like.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: From here, we proceed to the heart of Labyrinthos, and its most closely guarded secret─Thaumazein.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: It marks the beginning and end of our efforts─whence we delved to seek audience with the star, and whence we will embark on our journey to the heavens.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: This way, if you please.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: I bid you welcome to Thaumazein. Direct your attention toward its center to behold the ark over which we have long labored.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: As you can see, 'twas designed as a medium-sized craft, the better to reduce fuel consumption. Miniaturizing magicks have been applied to its interior to ensure that the thrust-to-weight ratio does not place too great a limitation on its freight capacity.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: The aetherburner, as you know, has been removed for further modification, but we shall reattach it soon enough.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: I have received word that Kokkol and several of your allies are working on it with an intense fervor.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: They are sure to see it done. 'Twas by their expertise that many a prior disaster was averted.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: If anything, I fear they will not afford us much time for speaking with Hydaelyn ere they finish...

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: Point taken. Let us move on. I must warn you again, however, that even with the benefit of our device, to treat with Her is not a simple feat.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: To think how many generations labored for this end...and that we aim higher still.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: We must spare no preparation─and that means speaking with Hydaelyn, no matter the cost.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I can well imagine the zeal with which they're working on the aetherburner, and all I can say is that I'm glad we have something to do other than get in their way.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Once it's ready, we'll see to it that the ship is put to good use!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I doubt this is what Erenville meant when he said that there remains much we do not know, but I still can't believe everything that was hidden underneath the city this entire time.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: 'Twould seem enchantments most advanced have been woven into the ship's very bones. Wilfsunn and Bloewyda were doubtless called upon for their expertise in teleportation magicks...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: We must learn of Hydaelyn's greater plan. We can only hope that She also knows the current location of Meteion...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: ...And we can do neither if we do not focus on whatever trial awaits us within.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: It was the Allagans who first combined the mechanical and aetherial sciences into a revolutionary discipline.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Given that this ship is nothing short of a technological marvel in that precise vein, Allagan salvage should suit it well.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: You feel it too, don't you? The ship is impressive, but it pales in comparison to the vast primordial power beneath our feet...

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: If meeting Hydaelyn proves difficult even for the Forum, then perhaps I─

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Oh, 'tis an unformed idea at this phase, I'm afraid. I will duly inform you if anything comes of it.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: I have done what I can to impress upon you the gravity of what lies ahead.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: Are you prepared?
